\section{Generation of MATH: Number Theory}
\label{sec:generation-MATH-Number-Theory}

\begin{longtable}{|l|p{8cm}|p{8cm}|}
\caption{New questions generated from Number Theory questions in the MATH dataset, and the closest question among the existing questions.}\\
\hline
\textbf{ID} & \textbf{Auto-Generated question} & \textbf{Closest question in the dataset}\\
\hline
1 & Find the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $n^2$ is a palindrome.& 
What is the smallest whole number $b$ such that 62 can be expressed in base $b$ using only three digits?
\\
\hline
2 & What is the base-10 representation of the base-8 number $1234_{8}$?& 
What is the base-ten number represented by the base-eight number 31?
\\
\hline
3 & Find the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $n^2$ is divisible by $2^{10}$ and $n^3$ is divisible by $3^{10}$.&
How many four-digit numbers whose digits add up to $9$ are divisible by $11$?
\\
\hline
4 & Find the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $n^2$ is a palindrome in base $10$ and in base $2$.& 
Express the product of $1001_2$ and $121_3$ in base 10.
\\ 
\hline
5 & Find the smallest prime divisor of $2^{16} + 1$. & Write a program that finds the number of positive divisors of 2002.
\\
\hline
6 & Find the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $n^2 \equiv 2 \pmod{10}$ and $n^2 \equiv 3 \pmod{14}$.&
Find $2^{-1} \pmod{185}$, as a residue modulo 185. (Give an answer between 0 and 184, inclusive.)
\\
\hline
7 & Find the smallest prime number that is divisible by $7$ and $13$.& 
How many four-digit numbers whose digits add up to $9$ are divisible by $11$?
\\
\hline
8 & Find the smallest integer $n$ such that $n^2 + n + 1$ is a perfect square. & 
What is the smallest whole number $b$ such that 62 can be expressed in base $b$ using only three digits?
\\
\hline
9 & What is the smallest whole number $b$ such that 89 can be expressed in base $b$ using only three digits? & 
What is the smallest whole number $b$ such that 62 can be expressed in base $b$ using only three digits?
\\
\hline
10 & Find the smallest positive integer $n$ such that $n^2+1$ is a palindrome. & 
What is the smallest whole number $b$ such that 62 can be expressed in base $b$ using only three digits?
\\
\hline
\end{longtable}
title: A Neural Network Solves, Explains, and Generates University Math Problems by Program Synthesis and Few-Shot Learning at Human Level
